intro: Cryptocarya australis, commonly known as the Australian laurel. It is a flowering plant in the family Lauraceae, native to eastern Australia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Cryptocarya australis is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
